definition: generic word for peoples or states of south China or south Asia at different historical periods/abbr. for Vietnam 越南
to exceed/to climb over/to surpass/the more... the more

sentences.english: The judge exceeded his powers in criticizing a court of appeal.
sentences.chinese: 法官越權對上訴法院進行批評。

sentences.english: Locked flash drive will protect your data from unauthorized access.
sentences.chinese: 掛鎖優盤可以防止你的數據被越權存取。

sentences.english: The doctrine of ultra vires in China is rooted in its planned economy ideology.
sentences.chinese: 中國的越權原則根植於計劃經濟的意識形態中。

sentences.english: You were exceeding your duty in opening those letters.
sentences.chinese: 你拆閱那些信件是越權了。

sentences.english: The state Supreme Court then ruled that the medical board had exceeded its prerogative in impeding state law.
sentences.chinese: 州最高法院遂裁決醫學委員會已越權妨礙州法律。

sentences.english: The judge exceeded his powers in criticizing the court ofappeal.
sentences.chinese: 法官越權對上訴法院進行指摘抉剔。

sentences.english: They say Obama has simply overstepped his bounds.
sentences.chinese: 他們說，奧巴馬總統越權操作。

sentences.english: However, the insurer may, in accordance with law, investigate the responsibility of the insurance agent that oversteps the authority delegated to it.
sentences.chinese: 但是保險人可以依法追究越權的保險代理人的責任。

sentences.english: Procedures for handling ultra vires transaction.
The insurer may pursue, in accordance with the law, liability of the insurance agent that acted ultra vires.
sentences.chinese: 保險人可以依法追究越權的保險代理人的責任。

definition: to appoint people by favoritism (idiom); nepotism/corrupt appointment
(of an official) corrupt and negligent of his duty
lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)
to damage the country and cause suffering to the people (idiom)
